ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Italian language applied to the economy, Italian music, film, and entertainment.
In ITAL 150, I improved my skills in reading, writing, listening to, and speaking Italian, but more importantly, I learned a lot about Italian culture that I did not know previously.
Discussion of many aspects of Italian culture. Learnt from the pupils around me.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class was good for exposure to many different aspects of Italian culture. I do think that it was difficult to connect with other students in the class and many students were disengaged during class. I think that more structured reading assignments could lead to more preparedness for class. Also, the minipresentations often felt like conversations with just the professor, so maybe if there was a more conversational component of the minipresentations, this could possibly increase discussion during class.
The low workload allowed us to take the class stress-free and really focus on meeting our individual Italian goals.

The course started quite well, with a written response due every Monday and a mini-presentation every Wednesday. I felt the workload was very doable (if anything a little light) and we learned a lot each class about Italian culture. However, the last month of class consisted mainly of watching an Italian Netflix TV show, which, while engaging, I felt perhaps detracted from our ability to learn more about Italian culture at the same speed that we did during the first half of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course if you like more unstructured Italian classes. Anna is very open to student suggestions and the assignments and topics outlined in the syllabus are not exactly what you'll end up doing.  Also the class gives a lot of freedom in regard to the topics that you can research for homework assignments.
Yes, because it's a stress-free way to continue learning a language,

I would recommend this course to any student wishing to take Italian at the L5 level. The course offers many opportunities to practice speaking, listening, reading, and writing, and you learn a lot about Italian culture in the process.
I would really recommend to other students. Enjoyable and engaging and a positive learning environment.
